title: Hungary Celebrates 50,000th Citi Life Credit Card Customer
summary: Budapest, Hungary - At a celebratory event in Budapest on April 22, 2013, Istvan Bodocs from Budapest was presented with the 50,000th Citi Life Credit Card. Citi Hungary reached this milestone only 22 months after the May 2011 launch of Citi Life, its unique multi-partner credit card in the Hungarian market. Citi Life customers in total benefited from nearly HUF647 million worth of Citi Forints that they could use for cash-back or other benefits of their choice from Citi's 22 program partners. A gift of 100,000 Citi Forints was presented to the 50,000th customer to use for cash back or purchasing from the Citi Life Webshop at his own discretion.
tag-1: Hungary Celebrates 50,000th Citi Life Credit Card Customer
tag-2: Budapest, Hungary – At a celebratory event in Budapest on April 22, 2013, Istvan Bodocs from Budapest was presented with the 50,000th Citi Life Credit Card. Citi Hungary reached this milestone only 22 months after the May 2011 launch of Citi Life, its unique multi-partner credit card in the Hungarian market. Citi Life customers in total benefited from nearly HUF647 million worth of Citi Forints that they could use for cash-back or other benefits of their choice from Citi's 22 program partners. A gift of 100,000 Citi Forints was presented to the 50,000th customer to use for cash back or purchasing from the Citi Life Webshop at his own discretion.
tag-3: Batara Sianturi, Citi Country Officer for Hungary, said: "We are very pleased to welcome Mr. Istvan Bodocs as our 50,000th credit card customer and are very grateful for his trust in Citi. We consider this a great milestone that reinforces our commitment to continuously innovate to meet the diverse financial and lifestyle needs of our customers. We were the first bank in the Hungarian market to offer a credit card in 1998, and since then we have been leading in innovation, including such unique functionalities as the Equal Payment Plan or Loan on Phone and Advanced Loan on Phone, just to mention a few, that provide preferential interest rates and even further, easy-to-access preapproved funds to help our customers manage their financial goals."
tag-4: Jon Wiggins, Consumer Business Manager for Hungary, also remarked: "A most recent innovation related to our Citi Life Credit Card was the launch of the first Sticker in the Hungarian credit card market last October. Also, in response to customer needs, we created our reward program to provide a 3 percent return on food retail purchases, a 2 percent return on petrol spends and a 1 percent return on all other retail purchases across Hungary, in addition to the opportunity to collect Citi Forints and discounts between 2-15 percent at more than 800 shops of our 22 Citi Life Program Partners. The number of PayPass terminals in Hungary is growing rapidly, currently reaching 15,000 outlets that give an increasing opportunity to our customers to experience the benefits of faster and easier shopping with their sticker."

tag-7: Important information Citi Life credit card APR: 29.7-45.4%, Equal Payment Plan APR: 26.8-33.8%, Loan on Phone APR: 34.8-35%, Advanced Loan on Phone APR: 30,9-39,5%. Citibank provides Credit Card and Sticker in line with the terms of its own loan appraisal. Sticker is a credit card applicable only for contactless PayPass purchases, that can be applied for simultaneously with credit card application only or linked to an existing credit card. Sticker's issuance fee is HUF 2500, APR: 44.7%. 3% refund on domestic food retail spend made with Citi Life card up to HUF 100,000; 2% refund on domestic fuel spend up to HUF 50,000; and 1% refund on transactions exceeding the previously stated thresholds within the monthly timeframe of the settlement period. The current list of Citi Life partners and partner shops where Citi Forints can be earned is available at www.citilife.hu internet website.
